title: Real-Time Hydraulic Modeling
description: A water utility uses a real-time hydraulic model (a 'digital twin') to simulate the effect of operational changes before they are made.

tasks.description: The operator wants to take a major water main out of service for repair. They first simulate this action in the hydraulic model.
tasks.expected_outcome: Operator inputs the proposed change into the digital twin.

tasks.description: The model predicts that taking the main out of service will cause low pressure for a residential neighborhood.
tasks.expected_outcome: The simulation identifies a potential negative impact.

tasks.description: The operator then simulates a mitigating action, such as re-routing water through a different main, and confirms this solves the low-pressure issue.
tasks.expected_outcome: The operator finds a safe way to perform the maintenance without impacting customers.
